intro: Mentha viridis subsp. candicans, commonly known as lemon balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its fragrant, serrated leaves that emit a citrus-like aroma. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pale blue or white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Mentha viridis subsp. candicans is often used in herbal medicine and as a culinary herb due to its calming properties.
